set_css_in_cell_output[source]

set_css_in_cell_output()

{% endraw %} {% raw %}

detect_theme[source]

detect_theme()

ipywidgets by default outputs black text for everything. Hard to read in Dark theme.

{% endraw %} {% raw %}
{% endraw %} {% raw %}

cypher[source]

cypher(text, decode=False, key='key')

Vigen√®re cipher: Not secure, just a way to not display plaintext

{% endraw %} {% raw %}

decypher[source]

decypher(text, key='key')

{% endraw %} {% raw %}
{% endraw %} {% raw %}

mc_widget[source]

mc_widget(description, options, correct_answer, decrypt_correct=False, random_order=False)

Multiple Choice question widget From zxzhaixiang's answer https://github.com/jupyter-widgets/ipywidgets/issues/2487#issuecomment-510721436 Decrypt answer added by SHH

{% endraw %} {% raw %}
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
Q1 = mc_widget('Which of these fruits is shaped like a pear?',['apple','banana','pear'],'pear')
display(Q1)
{% endraw %}

Randomize the choice order:

{% raw %} 
mc_widget('Which of these fruits is shaped like a pear?',['apple','banana','pear'],'pear', random_order=True)
{% endraw %}

Can also use an encrypted version of the correct answer:

{% raw %} 
cypher('pear')

'w5vDisOaw50='
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
decypher('w5vDisOaw50=')

'pear'
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
display(mc_widget('Which of these fruits is shaped like a pear?',['apple','banana','pear'],'w5vDisOaw50=',True))
{% endraw %}
